image.altText: A man at a workbench cuts a piece of engineered stone. He wears a full head covering.

props.synopsis: Builders and suppliers of engineered stone say their industries are crippled by confusion and a lack of detail from government about the impending ban on engineered stone.

title.children: Upcoming ban on engineered stone creates confusion as 'nobody knows what they're allowed to do'

image.altText: Two men in a composite photo.

props.synopsis: Tensions between Sikhs and Hindus were ratcheting up when Samar Kohli received a call from ASIO officers proposing a meeting.

title.children: As Trudeau publicly accused India of a ‘hit’, Australian spies were quietly making calls

image.altText: Donald Trump's face pictured against a backdrop of red and white horizonal stripes

props.synopsis: Now he's the Republicans' presumptive presidential nominee, Donald Trump's in full campaign mode, and his comments are proving as divisive as ever. We take a close look at what he's been saying he'll do if he's given another term in the White House.

title.children: 'I am your retribution': This is Trump's vision for America, in his own words

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: One of the country's most high-profile strata management firms has been "preying on people's ignorance" to hit apartment owners with exorbitant fees, ABC Investigations finds.

title.children: 'Preying on people's ignorance': Strata firm caught charging excessive fees to home owners

image.altText: Casino

props.synopsis: Cash transactions will be limited to less than $1,000, and there'll be a cap on how much can be drawn over 24 hours.

title.children: Queensland introduces cash limits and casino penalties in sweeping changes prompted by Star Entertainment report

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: The biggest monthly surge in employment outside of the COVID pandemic period has seen the unemployment rate tumble back to levels not seen since September last year.

title.children: Record monthly jobs gain drives unemployment back down to 3.7 per cent

image.altText: A line of people boarding an ADF aircraft on an airstrip in a remote community.

props.synopsis: More than 100 people have been evacuated from the remote community of Borroloola overnight, with authorities warning more could follow, ahead of a forecast "one-in-100 year" flood expected for the region.

title.children: Evacuations in remote community ahead of major flood in wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Megan

image.altText: Signage inside the Corruption and Crime Commission office in Perth, white text on black background with WA coat of arms

props.synopsis: An investigation into WA's anti-corruption agency has found one of its own officers went "rogue" and corruptly used her position for personal benefit.

title.children: Officer at WA's anti-corruption agency dismissed after using role for personal benefit, inquiry finds

image.altText: A woman next to a path

props.synopsis: Before she was diagnosed with ADHD, Alison Pike believed herself to be lazy and undisciplined. Researcher Kate Witteveen says women are often not believed when they seek a diagnosis.

title.children: Alison wasn't diagnosed with ADHD until age 48. Researchers say women often aren't believed

image.altText: A black and red beetle covered in long, spiky white hairs  on a smooth green leaf.

props.synopsis: Researchers investigating the discovery of the spiky-haired specimen say nothing of its kind has been seen in Australia before.

title.children: Punk beetle's chance discovery was almost disregarded as bird droppings

image.altText: An aerial view of a remote solar farm

props.synopsis: A solar farm with the power to service 90,000 homes has switched on in outback Queensland — powering one of the richest mining regions in the world. Experts say green energy will be key to Australia's role in filling global shortages of metals and minerals.

title.children: Australia's largest remote solar farm switched on to power outback Queensland mining industry

image.altText: Close up of Kevin Rudd

props.synopsis: The federal opposition's rush to jump on US presidential hopeful Donald Trump's character assessment of Australia's envoy in Washington could erode his standing in the capital, a former senior diplomat has warned.

title.children: Diplomat's warning not to erode Rudd's standing in Washington after Trump barbs

image.altText: Louis leans on his mum Kate.

props.synopsis: Britain's health minister says she's asked police to investigate claims staff at the hospital where Kate, Princess of Wales, had surgery in January, attempted to access her private medical records.

title.children: Claims hospital staff tried to access Kate Middleton's private health records referred to police

image.altText: A man with a beard and a blonde woman with serious expressions stand in front of a white fence, they are wearing collared shirts

props.synopsis: Despite taking their fight all the way to the United Nations, these farmers are facing a renewed battle against plans to build a mine near a major river system that flows to the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Farming community fighting international coal mine for 12 years faces renewed battle near Dawson River

image.altText: Three men in military uniform stand in front of an armoured vehicle in a field.

props.synopsis: Germany's parliament has approved a plan to buy more than 100 Boxer armoured vehicles in a deal being touted as Australia's "single biggest defence export" of all time.

title.children: Billion-dollar deal to supply Australian-made Boxer vehicles to Germany to be signed today

image.altText: Energy Minister Chris Bowen gives a TV interview.

props.synopsis: Minister for Climate Change and Energy Chris Bowen says the average build time for a nuclear power plant in the United States has been nearly two decades. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: Chris Bowen says the average build time of a nuclear plant in the US has been 19 years. Is that correct?

image.altText: Rear view of a silhouetted young businesswoman walking down a dark office corridor to a lit doorway.

props.synopsis: How strict non-disclosure agreements in sexual harassment cases can benefit the organisation and perpetrator instead of the victim.

title.children: Rachel was sexually harassed in her workplace, but she was the one who had to leave her job

image.altText: Police investigators photograph a crime scene at a single-storey home.

props.synopsis: A man was allegedly stabbed in the neck following an argument over cigarettes at a suburban home. The accused is expected to face court this morning.

title.children: Murder charge laid after argument about cigarettes between men in their 60s ends with alleged stabbing

image.altText: A white ferry with 'Searoad Ferries' on its side.

props.synopsis: Police say nobody has been injured after 22 passengers, including school students, were evacuated from a boat following fears of an engine fire.

title.children: Victorian ferry rescues children from boat after fears of engine fire

image.altText: Two lifeguards walking along the edge of a public pool

props.synopsis: It was designed to let more people enjoy the public pool during summer, but Orange City Council's decision to provide free entry to its residents resulted in "boofhead" behaviour.

title.children: Death threats, abuse of pool lifeguards and ejection of 250 people prompt re-think of free entry offer

image.altText: A doctor wears a blue gown and gloves in the background. A P2 mask sits in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Shingles cases are on the rise in New South Wales. Some doctors and researchers say COVID might be a contributing factor.

title.children: Health workers are seeing a rise in shingles. COVID might be part of the reason why

image.altText: Helen Dansie smiling.

props.synopsis: Peter Rex Dansie, who was found guilty of murdering his wife Helen in 2017, loses his second appeal against his conviction in South Australia's Court of Appeal.

title.children: Man who pushed disabled wife into pond loses second appeal against murder conviction

image.altText: Julian Assange looks to the camera as he is photographed from behind glass with graffiti etched into it. His grey hair is back.

props.synopsis: A lawyer for Julian Assange casts doubt on suggestions American prosecutors are considering downgrading the criminal charges against the detained WikiLeaks founder.

title.children: 'No indication' US Justice Department wants to resolve Assange case, says lawyer

image.altText: People standing near a fence looking at a wall with green paint behind a bare tree

props.synopsis: A London council says it is discussing future solutions to protect the art for others to enjoy after white paint was splashed over a mural of a tree.

title.children: Fencing and CCTV erected to protect Bansky artwork after white paint defacing

image.altText: Butler standing at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The health minister today will introduce legislation that bans the importation, manufacture, supply, and commercial possession of disposable single-use and non-therapeutic vapes unless they are used for legitimate health reasons. Follow live.

title.children: Health minister says taxing and regulating vapes a white flag to 'big tobacco'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Your questions on vaping legislation answered
Marles says government will continue to advocate on behalf of Julian Assange
Opposition receive copy of draft Religious Discrimination Bill

image.altText: orca and inset of sperm whale tale

props.synopsis: Observers look on in amazement as sperm whales off WA's southern coast successfully defend themselves from a pod of attacking killer whales by defecating at will, creating a "cloud of diarrhoea".

title.children: Sperm whales drop 'bubble of poo' off WA to prevent orca attack in rarely recorded encounter

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: An unhappy experience with the Voice referendum explains the Albanese government’s reticence to push ahead on religious freedoms. Debates that risk inflaming community tensions are best avoided for now, even if that means failing to deliver on an election promise, writes David Speers.

title.children: A long shadow looms for Albanese, as he waits for a deal with Dutton

image.altText: Michelle Heyman holding hands with another matildas player.

props.synopsis: The Matildas' hopes of winning a historic Olympic gold medal will face an early test after they were drawn alongside two heavyweights in the preliminary rounds for the Paris Games.

title.children: Matildas drawn with US and Germany in tough Paris Olympics group stage

image.altText: The silhouette of a steel lattice gas tower at dusk with a flare at the top

props.synopsis: Australia's energy market operator says the closure of a giant Victorian gas plant within years risks tipping supply into a shortage, but not everybody agrees.

title.children: Victoria and NSW among states facing gas shortages by 2028, AEMO warns, amid plunging supplies

image.altText: A submarine at the surface with morning sun on its right flank, the ocean stretches behind it

props.synopsis: Visiting British ministers are expected to strengthen military ties by agreeing to work towards a new agreement, which the United Kingdom has only ever enacted with its NATO partners.

title.children: Australia and UK expected to strengthen military ties ahead of nuclear-powered submarine delivery

image.altText: Handheld baby platypus

props.synopsis: The six-month-old female platypus is the first-known animal of its kind to be born in Australia's oldest national park in more than 50 years, and its arrival comes despite a series of recent pollution scares in local waterways.

title.children: Researchers 'over the moon' as miracle puggle is born in Sydney's Royal National Park

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: The US Federal Reserve left interest rates on hold at its meeting overnight, with the central bank indicating it's still likely to deliver three rate cuts by the end of the year. Meanwhile the ASX is trading higher, while the unemployment rate fell to 3.7 per cent in February. Follow live.

title.children: Unemployment rate falls to six-month low as more people find work, US Federal Reserve likely to cut rates by June

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Do you go to meetings to plan more meetings?
Home auctions tipped to go gangbusters over the Easter weekend
Australia's population grows to 27 million, driven by migrants

image.altText: A graphic of holding hands on a blue background with emojis.

props.synopsis: Experts say it's important young people can identify any unhealthy behaviour in a relationship early on, and address it. So what does a positive relationship look like and what are some of the things to look out for?

title.children: How to have a healthy relationship as a teenager
